org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common.messageq

Class MessageLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common.messageq.MessageLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageQ

    public class MessageLogger
extends Object
implements MessageQ
    This default message queue implementation prints all events to the Java logging subsystem.

    This is actually not a real message queue, and should be replaced with a connector to a message queue solution.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final void init(Map<String,?> properties)
        Initializes the message queue configuration

        A class implementing this interface must provide a reasonable default configuration and handle situations where the validate() method is called without a previous call of init() (i.e. do not throw a runtime exception).

        A class implementing this interface must ensure that subsequent calls to this method update the class' configuration in a thread-safe way.

        Available properties are:

        • jaas.messageq.enabled: whether this message queue is enabled (true/false)
        Specified by:
        init in interface MessageQ
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties to initialize the message queue with. Supported parameters may vary with the implementing classes.

      • create

        public final void create(Events event,
                         String userId)
        Create a message for the provided user ID (i.e. for the principal)
        Specified by:
        create in interface MessageQ
        Parameters:
        event - The event to create a message for
        userId - The user ID (globally unique) to create a message for

      • create

        public final void create(Events event,
                         String domain,
                         String username)
        Create a message for the provided username (not for the principal) in the specified white label domain

        A user is uniquely identified by the combination of domain and username.

        Specified by:
        create in interface MessageQ
        Parameters:
        event - The event to create a message for
        domain - The white label domain in which the username is located
        username - The username to audit activities for
